Calling Women Entrepreneurs in MedTech & CleanTech!
IKP EDEN is excited to announce an Ask Us Anything (AUA) session for BioXcelerate ‚Äì a flagship program under the WEscalate Initiative powered by K-tech Biotechnology Facilitation Cell Karnataka Innovation and Technology Society IT BT Department, Karnataka.

BioXcelerate offers a structured 6-month incubation phase followed by a 6-month acceleration phase, with a clear focus on translating high-potential science into scalable and sustainable ventures.

Date: 11th July at 6 PM
Location - IKP EDEN (Maps:¬†goo.gl/ur42sk)
Registration Link for AUA - https://lnkd.in/gvH_RGJs
Click here to apply for the program - https://lnkd.in/gDeybQHM (Last date to apply : 26th July, 2025)

This is an excellent opportunity for women entrepreneurs working in MedTech, CleanTech, and allied sectors to learn more about the program and explore how it can support your growth journey.

Join us to ask your questions, gain clarity, and take the next big step in your entrepreneurial journey.
Stay tuned for more updates!

Following World Zoonoses Day observed on July 6th, we‚Äôre spotlighting dengue ‚Äî one of the fastest-growing mosquito-borne diseases globally, with over ùüî.ùüï ùê¶ùê¢ùê•ùê•ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùêúùêöùê¨ùêûùê¨ reported in 2023 alone as per World Health Organization.

From climate change to rapid urbanisation, the spread of zoonotic diseases calls for a united response rooted in science, innovation, and collaboration.

At IKP, we're not just observing zoonotic threats‚Äîwe‚Äôre supporting solutions that reaffirm our commitment to climate-smart health systems and global collaborations where surveillance, science, and startups converge.

Let's innovate to prevent.

To collaborate with us, write to: engage@ikpknowledgepark.com 

And don't forget to follow IKP for more on health, science, and impact.

We are constantly inspired by purpose-driven solutions that tackle critical public health challenges at the grassroots.
 
Bengaluru-based Janitri Innovations, an IKP-supported, startup quietly transforming maternal and newborn health through frugal innovation, is a powerful reminder that big change often begins with small, thoughtful steps.
 
We celebrate ventures that combine empathy and engineering to create scalable, life-saving interventions.
 
Janitri is supported by programs like AGC JanCARE, a part of our portfolio, and is incubated at IKP EDEN. As ecosystem enablers, stories like these reinforce our belief in nurturing science and technology for inclusive growth.

https://www.linkedin.com/company/biotech.text: The last date is approaching soon!

Let‚Äôs Celebrate #WorldBioProductsDay- the #BioE3 Way

The Department of Biotechnology is celebrating #WorldBioProductsDay: the #BioE3 way today. Join us in celebrating India‚Äôs new beginning towards bio-based circular economy. 

The Union Cabinet chaired by our Hon‚Äôble Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi approved DBT‚Äôs #BioE3 policy on 24th August 2024. Since then, we have been continuously striving forward in this direction. Under the BioE3 policy, we joined hands with the Indian Space Research Organization #ISRO and signed MoU on Space Biomanufacturing/ Biotechnology. DBT-BIRAC joint call for proposals were announced for the different thematic sectors of BioE3. In order to disseminate information about the various components of the biofoundry and biomanufacturing initiative to various stakeholders, a fortnightly webinar series was launched by DBT in partnership with BIRAC. To strengthen a strong innovation ecosystem at state-level, the Centre-State Partnership conclave was conducted under the leadership of Hon‚Äôble Minister Dr. Jitendra Singh ji. Soon after the conclave, a landmark MoU was signed between DBT and the Government of Assam, making Assam the first state in the country to establish a dedicated #BioE3 cell. 

#BioE3 will usher a new scientific revolution in biomanufacturing driven by regenerative principles. The policy framework creates a convergence between biotech, engineering and digitalization for building a more equitable and sustainable future through Biomanufacturing. As we are celebrating #WorldBioProductsDay: the #BioE3 way, we want to emphasize on the importance and raise awareness about the significance of bioproducts in our daily lives and celebrate sustainable innovations that contribute to environmental well-being.¬†

This year, DBT celebrates¬†'World Bioproduct Day ‚Äì The BioE3 Way',¬†featuring: Voices Across the Cities-A Synchronized National Hourly Dialogue Series¬†on¬†7th July, 2025. In this unique format, each of the iBRIC+ will spotlight on bioproduct innovation, biomanufacturing, and regional voices aligned with the BioE3 agenda. The objectives are to celebrate the value of bioproducts as key to circular and sustainable growth; mobilize city-level ecosystems to showcase local innovation and DBT impact; create a national platform for decentralized conversations and highlight how biotechnology contributes to zero-waste systems, green jobs, and local economic value creation.¬†

Join us here: https://lnkd.in/gp6mhf_j 

Dr Jitendra Singh | Rajesh Gokhale | BRIC DBT | DBT BIRAC | Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC)

The Department of Biotechnology Celebrates World Bioproduct Day‚ÄîThe BioE3 Way, 2025!
Featuring: Voices Across the Cities ‚Äì A Synchronized National Hourly Dialogue Series

When: 7th July 2025, from 10:15 AM onwards
Watch Live on YouTube: https://lnkd.in/gjwDhEVD

Loopworm has developed a new approach to producing recombinant proteins using silkworms which will target diagnostics, animal vaccines and other applications. IIT Mandi Catalyst recently organized a focused workshop titled Investment Outreach‚Äô for its incubated startups, led by Vikrant Potnis, Founder of Fundenable, for a deep-dive session into the realities of fundraising and startup scale-up in India. With a rich background in investment banking and venture capital, Vikrant shared powerful insights on:

üí° The three pillars of fundraising:
 ‚úîÔ∏è Fundability
 ‚úîÔ∏è Technical process
 ‚úîÔ∏è Investor access

üîç He also presented case studies from successful Fundenable portfolio startups like EMotorad, WorkIndia, and SuperBottoms, illustrating how strategic funding and strong execution drive exponential growth.

üëè Startup Spotlight | SmartEye ‚Äì Empowering the Visually Impaired
We‚Äôre proud to share that Smart Eye SmartEye, a portfolio startup of IIT Mandi Catalyst, is making remarkable strides with its innovation, PathPal ‚Äì a smart blind stick designed to enhance mobility for the visually impaired.

Recently, the PathPal prototype underwent extensive user testing across multiple blind schools, where users explored the device in real-world settings. The team received valuable feedback and built trust within the community‚Äîensuring the product truly meets user needs.

üîç About SmartEye:
 SmartEye operates in the assistive technology space within the healthtech sector, developing intelligent solutions using ultrasonic sensors and AI/ML algorithms to solve navigation challenges for the visually impaired.

We‚Äôre excited to see how SmartEye continues to make a real-world impact! üåçüí°

The discussion will cover practical steps, decisions, and partnerships that support progress in climate and emerging sectors.

We were delighted to welcome faculty members from the Dayananda Sagar Business Academy as part of a Faculty Development Program (FDP) aimed at bridging the gap between academic knowledge and entrepreneurial application.

The session included an engaging walkthrough of DERBI Foundation‚Äôs lab and Dayananda Sagar University's innovation campus at Kudlu Gate, where faculty had the opportunity to experience the startup ecosystem up close, from ideation spaces to prototyping labs, and incubation support facilities.

The visit sparked meaningful conversations around how real-world problem-solving, startup exposure, and innovation-driven thinking can be brought into the classroom to better prepare students for tomorrow‚Äôs challenges.

We look forward to more such academia-industry interactions that nurture a stronger entrepreneurial culture on campuses! üå±üí°

Belagavi,¬†Gets a Boost of AI Brilliance with its UNNATI AI workshop at KLE Academy of Higher Education and Research!

The UNNATI AI Workshop, organized by FITT, IIT Delhi in collaboration with Microsoft, was hosted at the KAHER Incubation and Innovation Foundation, KLE Academy of Higher Education and Research, Belagavi, Karnataka, brought together a dynamic ecosystem of students, startups, and innovators - all driven by the shared vision of transforming ideas into real-world AI solutions.

The highlight? FITT introduced its flagship UNNATI AI Accelerator, offering grant support of up to ‚Çπ30 Lakhs to selected innovators ready to scale impactful AI-based solutions.

Another key moment was the insightful session by ITTO (Innovation-Technology Transfer Office Foundation for Innovation Technology Transfer), which opened doors for participants to explore global pathways for deep tech commercialization and innovation transfer.

Special thanks to Dr. Preeti K. Doddwad, M.D.S., Professor, Dept. of Conservative Dentistry and Co-ordinator, KLE English Medium Schools, and Dr. Neha Dhaded, Associate Professor, KLE Vishwanath Katti Institute of Dental Sciences, for their support and coordination.

We extend our heartfelt appreciation to KIIF for hosting the FITT - IIT Delhi's team and for their integral role in the success of this collaborative initiative.

https://www.linkedin.com/company/social-.text:
Innovators working on developing medical devices for screening and diagnosis often struggle with accessing funds for clinical trials and regulatory pathways. At this stage equity funding is almost non-existent.  (Sometimes it may be there but comes with extremely bad terms combined wifh hyper-dilution and horrific captables). 

This is where blended finance needs to be redefined. Capital providers need to understand that  de-risking early stage startups requires a continuum of capital where non dilutive and dilutive capital pools operate synchronously throughtout the product lifecycle depending upon the stage, complexity and market readiness of the innovations. This is not like a relay race where capital providers change roles but more like an orchestra where different pools can synchronise their risk underwriting and maximise the impact while creating value as the innovations transition from the lab to market.

#blendedfinance #valleyofdeath #impact #innovation  Social Alpha

In agriculture, productivity is only part of the story. 

Without efficient post-harvest systems, much of what‚Äôs grown is lost, or sold at distress prices. 

Farmers need access to infrastructure that preserves produce quality, extends shelf-life life, and enables value addition. For perishable crops, in particular, the time between harvest and sale is critical. 

We‚Äôre inviting start-ups developing solutions for: 

- Affordable, accessible preservation and processing¬†
- Modular storage with hybrid or passive cooling¬†
- Off-grid or decentralised post-harvest infrastructure¬†
- Quality monitoring, grading, and traceability 

Solutions should be relevant to smallholder farmers, and adaptable to a range of crops and geographies.¬†
¬†
Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and design support, incubation, mentorship, and access to scale-up networks.
¬†
Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony
¬†
#FarmingForward #PostHarvestInnovation #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

Impact investing and blended finance were supposed to fund what the market wouldn‚Äôt‚Äîideas that are too early, too complex, too local, or too long-term. Instead, they have become vehicles for funding what the market already wants, just with less risk and more narrative dressing.

We recently hosted a fantastic "Founder's Playbook: Smart Moves for Sustainable Startups" hybrid session, engaging around 30 entrepreneurs both online and in our auditorium! It was a powerful experience diving into strategic growth for new startups.

The session, expertly led by Dipanjay Bhalerao, Deputy Director, Indira Institute of Management, Pune (MBA), offered practical and thought-provoking insights:

‚Ä¢ Strategic Startup Categorization: Participants gained clarity on distinguishing between High/Low Investment and Innovation models, prompting them to assess their own ventures.

‚Ä¢ The B.I.O. Model: Mr. Bhalerao introduced his impactful Business, Investment, and Offering Innovation model, illustrated with compelling examples of capex reduction, smart outsourcing (like Airtel), and revenue streams (like Apple's app ecosystem).

‚Ä¢ Innovation vs. Disruption: A crucial discussion that provided a clearer understanding of these pivotal concepts.

‚Ä¢ The Power of Collaboration: Emphasizing how partnerships drive significant growth in the startup ecosystem.

A huge thank you to Dipanjay Bhalerao for sharing his profound knowledge and making the session so valuable. We also extend our gratitude to all the entrepreneurs who actively participated and made this event a resounding success!

Padmaraj Pattanashetti | ABHISHEK kajagar | Vishwadharmi K Sharma | Karan SG Doddwad | Vaibhav Dhulla | Ayush Shetty | Soumya Chaugala | Prashant Pammar

Over the past two weeks, VentureStudio hosted two engaging events that brought together students, makers, and founders from across the ecosystem.

We began with a hands-on 3D Printing Workshop at DST Prayas Shala, where participants explored the fundamentals of additive manufacturing, from basic design principles to operating a 3D printer. Attendees created their own prototypes and gained practical exposure to tools that enable rapid innovation. 

This was followed by a powerful panel discussion on "Building Startup Teams and Company Culture," featuring founders who‚Äôve built successful ventures across sectors. Dr. Purav Gandhi (Healthark), Aenik Shah (Wizzy.ai), Abhishek Acharya (Theka Coffee), Shalin (Shawn) Parikh (MYCPE ONE), Shrijay Sheth (LegalWiz.in) and Jatin Chaudhary (eChai Ventures) shared hard-earned insights on hiring, values, and leadership. The room was filled with students, early-stage entrepreneurs, and professionals eager to learn what it really takes to build cohesive, high-performing teams.

Thank you to all the speakers and participants for making these sessions impactful. Stay tuned for more events from VentureStudio.

#Innovation #Entrepreneurship #3DPrinting #StartupCulture #AhmedabadUniversity #StartupIndia #DesignToPrototype #Founders #TeamBuilding
